body.label: Recto
body.value:
1. Test[imony which was before us—we, the undersigned witnesses—on … of the week]
  2. which w[as … years (of the Era) of Documents, according to the count] to which [we are accustomed]
  3. [in Fusṭāṭ Egypt, situated on the Nile River. Thus: … came before us]
  4. b. Mr. A[… and said to us, “Testify on my behalf, and perform a qinyan with me effective immediately, write and sign concerning me using all the appropriate legal formulae and the expressions of certainty]
  5. and all the lang[uage of claims, and give that to … in order that he would have proof and a legal claim from this day forward that I attest before you in my good health and freedom of will, willingly, with neither]
  6. duress nor [force nor compulsion, without negligence or error, nor defect of illness within me, nor anything of the like from all the factors which nullify testimony …]
  7. God, may [His Na]me be exalted […]
  8. and each of us came to […]
  9. his, and each of us has released [his] fe[llow …]
  10. I, Japheth ha-Kohen, from my assets … […]
  11. this (Japheth, glory of) the Congregation, from his assets, forty dinars in specie, which became […]
  12. (his) hon(or, our) tea(cher) and m(aster,) this Japheth, Glory of the Congregation, will have the right of disposal for […]
  13. expenditure. The term of this partnership (shirka) is twelve months […]
  14. mentioned above in the body of this document from him to … […]
  15. dinars. At the end of these six months […]
  16. assets, one hundred dinars. He also received from […]
  17. between us for a period of six months, the last in […]
  18. (and whatever) the Heavens mercifully provide therein in terms of profi[t …]
  19. I am entitled to half—and, God forbid, if there is a loss there[in, …]
  20. I will have (responsibility for) half, exactly. Every four months a reckoning will be performed […]
  21. for himself as well that which falls as his share. I have declared—I [… (him to be) trustworthy as two]
  22. proper [witnesses] concerning all that he received on my behalf in terms of profit […]
  23. these twelve months in this manner […]
  24. the assets will be for a (formal) legal arrangement between us therein, and no action […]
  25. this (Mr. Japheth, Glory of) the Congregation from all the aforementione[d] conditions […]
  26. and the two of them took upon themselves responsibility for all that after […]
  27. (their heirs) after them, for this is not like promises and not like formul[aries, but rather (bears) the weight and force of all documents …]
  28. which are enacted under the penalty of the Sages and are universally employed, from this da[y forward, nullifying all secret dispositions and conditions in any language]
  29. which the Sages employed to nullify secret dispositions and condition[s. We performed a qinyan with … concerning everything written and stipulated]
  30. above, with an item suitable for doing so. Proper [and enduring. We wrote and signed and gave it to …]
  31. in order that he would have proof and a legal claim. He wrote these […]
